p: There are three families of GSH transferases which are divided on the basis of location. They are cytosolic, mitochondrial, and membrane-associated microsomal. They help the body to neutralize secondary metabolites such as aldehydes, epoxides, and hydroperoxides [ 173, 174]. This enzyme helps in the detoxification of toxicants and metabolites in the body. It inhibits the activities of kinase involved in the MAPK pathway that regulates cell proliferation and death [ 175, 176].
